org.epochx.life
Interface ConfigListener

All Superinterfaces:
Listener
All Known Implementing Classes:
ConfigAdapter, ConfigOperator, CrossoverManager, DepthFirstMapper, ElitismManager, FitnessProportionateSelector, FixedLengthInitialiser, FixedPointCrossover, FullInitialiser, FullInitialiser, FullInitialiser, GenerationManager, GrowInitialiser, GrowInitialiser, GrowInitialiser, InitialisationManager, KozaCrossover, LinearRankSelector, MutationManager, OnePointCrossover, OnePointCrossover, PointMutation, PointMutation, PoolSelectionManager, RampedHalfAndHalfInitialiser, RampedHalfAndHalfInitialiser, RampedHalfAndHalfInitialiser, RandomSelector, ReproductionManager, RunManager, SinglePointMutation, StandardGenerator, SubtreeCrossover, SubtreeMutation, TournamentSelector, WhighamCrossover, WhighamMutation
public interface ConfigListener
extends Listener

Provides the interface to be implemented by objects that wish to listen for configure events. Configure events are specifically for triggering the configuration of components with parameters from the model, and are called at the start of execution and prior to the start of each run. The event may also be fired manually with a call to the Life's fireConfigureEvent() method. To listen for configure events during execution of a model, instances of ConfigListener must be added to the Life instance which is retrievable through a call to the static get() method.

It is typical to listen to events using an anonymous class which often makes the abstract ConfigAdapter class more convenient to implement.

See Also:
ConfigAdapter

Method Summary
 void onConfigure()
          This event is automatically fired at the recommended times for loading model parameters - that is at the start of model execution and at the start of each successive run.
 

Method Detail

onConfigure

void onConfigure()
This event is automatically fired at the recommended times for loading model parameters - that is at the start of model execution and at the start of each successive run. It may also be triggered manually, potentially by the model if it updates its parameters at an unorthadox time in the life cycle.
